alert.note: Alert for Chickasaw; Fayette; Howard; Winneshiek (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LaCrosse (Southwestern Wisconsin, Southeastern Minnesota, and Northeast Iowa)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 28 at 5:48PM CST until January 28 at 10:00PM CST by NWS LaCrosse
info.description: ...SNOW CONTINUES THIS EVENING... .Snow continues to primarily affect parts of northeast Iowa into southwest Wisconsin early this evening. Periods of higher snowfall rates will occur this evening, causing visibilities to trop below a mile at times. Impacts to travel will continue into the overnight, especially across northeast Iowa into southwest Wisconsin. Check road conditions before traveling tonight and drive with caution. A wind chill advisory has been issued for counties in southeastern Minnesota and northeast Iowa where wind chills below -20 degrees are expected into Sunday morning. With these wind chill temperatures, frostbite can occur in 30 minutes or less. ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM CST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Snow. Additional snow accumulations of up to one inch. * WHERE...Howard, Winneshiek, Chickasaw and Fayette Counties. * WHEN...Until 10 PM CST this evening. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. Visit 511ia.org for road conditions.
